disc:
Asbestosis refers to pneumoconiosis due to inhalation of asbestos fibers. It results in slowly progressive, diffuse lung fibrosis.

Clinical features include breathlessness on exertion. Cough, wheezing and sputum production are unusual.

Benign asbestos pleural effusions are small, unilateral effusions which resolve spontaneously over few months. They can recur. Pleural changes are plaques and diffuse pleural thickening which might calcify. Malignant mesothelioma is associated with asbestos exposure.
